page.title: 19CLUBS:SLAITHWAITE BAND.
page.content: In the days when there was no cinema or radio,country people organized their own entertainment and Brass Band playing was popular.Slaithwaite Band was formed in 1892 and was originally known as the Upper Slaithwaite Reed and Brass Band. In 1925,the Band moved to its present headquarters at Ing Head.In the 1930's the band was reaching its peak and won the British Championships at Belle Vue in 1938.They have also celebrated three Grand Shield victories in 1905, 1933 and 1962. The Junior Section was formed in 1962. At present they are 25-strong and play at local events in and around the Colne Valley.The Senior Band is going through a transitional period at the moment but hopes are high that the long tradition of fine Colne Valley Brass Band playing will long continue.
